intro: Boehmeria dasypoda, commonly known as the roughleaf nettle, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging nettle species. The plant is characterized by its hairy, serrated leaves and small greenish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Boehmeria dasypoda is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
